-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Simulation experiments with charting for the Aivika library
--   
@package aivika-experiment-chart
@version 4.2


-- | Tested with: GHC 7.10.1
--   
--   The module defines some utilities used in the charting.
module Simulation.Aivika.Experiment.Chart.Utils

-- | Colourise the plot lines.
colourisePlotLines :: [PlotLines x y -> PlotLines x y]

-- | Colourise the filling areas.
colourisePlotFillBetween :: [PlotFillBetween x y -> PlotFillBetween x y]

-- | Colourise the plot bars.
colourisePlotBars :: PlotBars x y -> PlotBars x y


-- | Tested with: GHC 7.10.1
--   
--   The module defines a type class for rendering charts.
module Simulation.Aivika.Experiment.Chart.Types

-- | A type class of chart renderers.
class ChartRendering r
renderableChartExtension :: ChartRendering r => r -> String
renderChart :: ChartRendering r => r -> (Int, Int) -> FilePath -> Renderable c -> IO (PickFn c)


-- | Tested with: GHC 7.10.1
--   
--   The module defines <a>TimeSeriesView</a> that plots the time series
--   charts.
module Simulation.Aivika.Experiment.Chart.TimeSeriesView

-- | Defines the <tt>View</tt> that plots the time series charts.
data TimeSeriesView
TimeSeriesView :: String -> String -> Int -> Int -> ExperimentFilePath -> Event Bool -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> String -> String -> [PlotLines Double Double -> PlotLines Double Double] -> (LayoutAxis Double -> LayoutAxis Double) -> (LayoutLR Double Double Double -> LayoutLR Double Double Double) -> TimeSeriesView

-- | This is a title used in HTML.
timeSeriesTitle :: TimeSeriesView -> String

-- | This is a description used in HTML.
timeSeriesDescription :: TimeSeriesView -> String

-- | The width of the chart.
timeSeriesWidth :: TimeSeriesView -> Int

-- | The height of the chart.
timeSeriesHeight :: TimeSeriesView -> Int

-- | It defines the file name with optional extension for each image to be
--   saved. It may include special variables <tt>$TITLE</tt>,
--   <tt>$RUN_INDEX</tt> and <tt>$RUN_COUNT</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   timeSeriesFileName = UniqueFilePath "$TITLE - $RUN_INDEX"
--   </pre>
timeSeriesFileName :: TimeSeriesView -> ExperimentFilePath

-- | It specifies the predicate that defines when we plot data in the
--   chart.
timeSeriesPredicate :: TimeSeriesView -> Event Bool

-- | The transform applied to the results before receiving series.
timeSeriesTransform :: TimeSeriesView -> ResultTransform

-- | It defines the series plotted basing on the left Y axis.
timeSeriesLeftYSeries :: TimeSeriesView -> ResultTransform

-- | It defines the series plotted basing on the right Y axis.
timeSeriesRightYSeries :: TimeSeriesView -> ResultTransform

-- | This is a title used in the chart when simulating a single run. It may
--   include special variable <tt>$TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   timeSeriesPlotTitle = "$TITLE"
--   </pre>
timeSeriesPlotTitle :: TimeSeriesView -> String

-- | The run title for the chart. It is used when simulating multiple runs
--   and it may include special variables <tt>$RUN_INDEX</tt>,
--   <tt>$RUN_COUNT</tt> and <tt>$PLOT_TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   timeSeriesRunPlotTitle = "$PLOT_TITLE / Run $RUN_INDEX of $RUN_COUNT"
--   </pre>
timeSeriesRunPlotTitle :: TimeSeriesView -> String

-- | Probably, an infinite sequence of plot transformations based on which
--   the plot is constructed for each series. Generally, it must not
--   coincide with a sequence of labels as one label may denote a whole
--   list or an array of data providers.
--   
--   Here you can define a colour or style of the plot lines.
timeSeriesPlotLines :: TimeSeriesView -> [PlotLines Double Double -> PlotLines Double Double]

-- | A transformation of the bottom axis, after title <tt>time</tt> is
--   added.
timeSeriesBottomAxis :: TimeSeriesView -> LayoutAxis Double -> LayoutAxis Double

-- | A transformation of the plot layout, where you can redefine the axes,
--   for example.
timeSeriesLayout :: TimeSeriesView -> LayoutLR Double Double Double -> LayoutLR Double Double Double

-- | The default time series view.
defaultTimeSeriesView :: TimeSeriesView
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView TimeSeriesView (FileRenderer r)
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView TimeSeriesView (WebPageRenderer r)


-- | Tested with: GHC 7.10.1
--   
--   The module defines <a>XYChartView</a> that plots the XY charts.
module Simulation.Aivika.Experiment.Chart.XYChartView

-- | Defines the <tt>View</tt> that plots the XY charts.
data XYChartView
XYChartView :: String -> String -> Int -> Int -> ExperimentFilePath -> Event Bool -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> String -> String -> [PlotLines Double Double -> PlotLines Double Double] -> (LayoutAxis Double -> LayoutAxis Double) -> (LayoutLR Double Double Double -> LayoutLR Double Double Double) -> XYChartView

-- | This is a title used in HTML.
xyChartTitle :: XYChartView -> String

-- | This is a description used in HTML.
xyChartDescription :: XYChartView -> String

-- | The width of the chart.
xyChartWidth :: XYChartView -> Int

-- | The height of the chart.
xyChartHeight :: XYChartView -> Int

-- | It defines the file name with optional extension for each image to be
--   saved. It may include special variables <tt>$TITLE</tt>,
--   <tt>$RUN_INDEX</tt> and <tt>$RUN_COUNT</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   xyChartFileName = UniqueFilePath "$TITLE - $RUN_INDEX"
--   </pre>
xyChartFileName :: XYChartView -> ExperimentFilePath

-- | It specifies the predicate that defines when we plot data in the
--   chart.
xyChartPredicate :: XYChartView -> Event Bool

-- | The transform applied to the results before receiving series.
xyChartTransform :: XYChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | This is the X series.
--   
--   You must define it, because it is <a>mempty</a> by default. Also it
--   must return exactly one <tt>ResultExtract</tt> item when calling
--   function <tt>extractDoubleResults</tt> by the specified result set.
xyChartXSeries :: XYChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | It defines the series plotted basing on the left Y axis.
xyChartLeftYSeries :: XYChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | It defines the series plotted basing on the right Y axis.
xyChartRightYSeries :: XYChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | This is a title used in the chart when simulating a single run. It may
--   include special variable <tt>$TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   xyChartPlotTitle = "$TITLE"
--   </pre>
xyChartPlotTitle :: XYChartView -> String

-- | The run title for the chart. It is used when simulating multiple runs
--   and it may include special variables <tt>$RUN_INDEX</tt>,
--   <tt>$RUN_COUNT</tt> and <tt>$PLOT_TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   xyChartRunPlotTitle = "$PLOT_TITLE / Run $RUN_INDEX of $RUN_COUNT"
--   </pre>
xyChartRunPlotTitle :: XYChartView -> String

-- | Probably, an infinite sequence of plot transformations based on which
--   the plot is constructed for each Y series. Generally, it may not
--   coincide with a sequence of Y labels as one label may denote a whole
--   list or an array of data providers.
--   
--   Here you can define a colour or style of the plot lines.
xyChartPlotLines :: XYChartView -> [PlotLines Double Double -> PlotLines Double Double]

-- | A transformation of the bottom axis, after the X title is added.
xyChartBottomAxis :: XYChartView -> LayoutAxis Double -> LayoutAxis Double

-- | A transformation of the plot layout, where you can redefine the axes,
--   for example.
xyChartLayout :: XYChartView -> LayoutLR Double Double Double -> LayoutLR Double Double Double

-- | The default time series view.
defaultXYChartView :: XYChartView
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView XYChartView (FileRenderer r)
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView XYChartView (WebPageRenderer r)


-- | Tested with: GHC 7.10.1
--   
--   The module defines <a>FinalXYChartView</a> that plots a single XY
--   chart in final time points for different simulation runs sequentially
--   by the run index.
module Simulation.Aivika.Experiment.Chart.FinalXYChartView

-- | Defines the <tt>View</tt> that plots the XY chart in final time points
--   for different simulation runs sequentially by the run index.
data FinalXYChartView
FinalXYChartView :: String -> String -> Int -> Int -> ExperimentFilePath -> Event Bool -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> String -> [PlotLines Double Double -> PlotLines Double Double] -> (LayoutAxis Double -> LayoutAxis Double) -> (LayoutLR Double Double Double -> LayoutLR Double Double Double) -> FinalXYChartView

-- | This is a title used HTML.
finalXYChartTitle :: FinalXYChartView -> String

-- | This is a description used in HTML.
finalXYChartDescription :: FinalXYChartView -> String

-- | The width of the chart.
finalXYChartWidth :: FinalXYChartView -> Int

-- | The height of the chart.
finalXYChartHeight :: FinalXYChartView -> Int

-- | It defines the file name with optional extension for each image to be
--   saved. It may include special variable <tt>$TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   finalXYChartFileName = UniqueFilePath "$TITLE"
--   </pre>
finalXYChartFileName :: FinalXYChartView -> ExperimentFilePath

-- | It specifies the predicate that defines when we count data when
--   plotting the chart.
finalXYChartPredicate :: FinalXYChartView -> Event Bool

-- | The transform applied to the results before receiving series.
finalXYChartTransform :: FinalXYChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | This is the X series.
--   
--   You must define it, because it is <a>mempty</a> by default. Also it
--   must return exactly one <tt>ResultExtract</tt> item when calling
--   function <tt>extractDoubleResults</tt> by the specified result set.
finalXYChartXSeries :: FinalXYChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | It defines the series to be plotted basing on the left Y axis.
finalXYChartLeftYSeries :: FinalXYChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | It defines the series to be plotted basing on the right Y axis.
finalXYChartRightYSeries :: FinalXYChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | This is a title used in the chart. It may include special variable
--   <tt>$TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   finalXYChartPlotTitle = "$TITLE"
--   </pre>
finalXYChartPlotTitle :: FinalXYChartView -> String

-- | Probably, an infinite sequence of plot transformations based on which
--   the plot is constructed for each series. Generally, it may not
--   coincide with a sequence of labels as one label may denote a whole
--   list or an array of data providers.
--   
--   Here you can define a colour or style of the plot lines.
finalXYChartPlotLines :: FinalXYChartView -> [PlotLines Double Double -> PlotLines Double Double]

-- | A transformation of the bottom axis, after the X title is added.
finalXYChartBottomAxis :: FinalXYChartView -> LayoutAxis Double -> LayoutAxis Double

-- | A transformation of the plot layout, where you can redefine the axes,
--   for example.
finalXYChartLayout :: FinalXYChartView -> LayoutLR Double Double Double -> LayoutLR Double Double Double

-- | The default XY chart view.
defaultFinalXYChartView :: FinalXYChartView
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView FinalXYChartView (FileRenderer r)
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView FinalXYChartView (WebPageRenderer r)


-- | Tested with: GHC 7.10.1
--   
--   The module defines <a>DeviationChartView</a> that plots the deviation
--   chart using rule of 3-sigma.
module Simulation.Aivika.Experiment.Chart.DeviationChartView

-- | Defines the <tt>View</tt> that plots the deviation chart.
data DeviationChartView
DeviationChartView :: String -> String -> Int -> Int -> ExperimentFilePath -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> String -> [PlotLines Double Double -> PlotLines Double Double] -> [PlotFillBetween Double Double -> PlotFillBetween Double Double] -> (LayoutAxis Double -> LayoutAxis Double) -> (LayoutLR Double Double Double -> LayoutLR Double Double Double) -> DeviationChartView

-- | This is a title used in HTML.
deviationChartTitle :: DeviationChartView -> String

-- | This is a description used in HTML.
deviationChartDescription :: DeviationChartView -> String

-- | The width of the chart.
deviationChartWidth :: DeviationChartView -> Int

-- | The height of the chart.
deviationChartHeight :: DeviationChartView -> Int

-- | It defines the file name with optional extension for each image to be
--   saved. It may include special variable <tt>$TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   deviationChartFileName = UniqueFilePath "$TITLE"
--   </pre>
deviationChartFileName :: DeviationChartView -> ExperimentFilePath

-- | The transform applied to the results before receiving series.
deviationChartTransform :: DeviationChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | It defines the series to be plotted basing on the left Y axis.
deviationChartLeftYSeries :: DeviationChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | It defines the series to be plotted basing on the right Y axis.
deviationChartRightYSeries :: DeviationChartView -> ResultTransform

-- | This is a title used in the chart. It may include special variable
--   <tt>$TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   deviationChartPlotTitle = "$TITLE"
--   </pre>
deviationChartPlotTitle :: DeviationChartView -> String

-- | Probably, an infinite sequence of plot transformations based on which
--   the plot is constructed for each series. Generally, it may not
--   coincide with a sequence of labels as one label may denote a whole
--   list or an array of data providers.
--   
--   Here you can define a colour or style of the plot lines.
deviationChartPlotLines :: DeviationChartView -> [PlotLines Double Double -> PlotLines Double Double]

-- | Corresponds exactly to <a>deviationChartPlotLines</a> but used for
--   plotting the deviation areas by the rule of 3-sigma, while the former
--   is used for plotting the trends of the random processes.
deviationChartPlotFillBetween :: DeviationChartView -> [PlotFillBetween Double Double -> PlotFillBetween Double Double]

-- | A transformation of the bottom axis, after title <tt>time</tt> is
--   added.
deviationChartBottomAxis :: DeviationChartView -> LayoutAxis Double -> LayoutAxis Double

-- | A transformation of the plot layout, where you can redefine the axes,
--   for example.
deviationChartLayout :: DeviationChartView -> LayoutLR Double Double Double -> LayoutLR Double Double Double

-- | The default deviation chart view.
defaultDeviationChartView :: DeviationChartView
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView DeviationChartView (FileRenderer r)
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView DeviationChartView (WebPageRenderer r)


-- | Tested with: GHC 7.10.1
--   
--   The module defines <a>HistogramView</a> that plots the histogram
--   collecting statistics in all integration time points and does it for
--   every simulation run separately.
module Simulation.Aivika.Experiment.Chart.HistogramView

-- | Defines the <tt>View</tt> that plots the histogram collecting
--   statistics for all integration time points but for each simulation run
--   separately.
data HistogramView
HistogramView :: String -> String -> Int -> Int -> ExperimentFilePath -> Event Bool -> ([[Double]] -> Histogram) -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> String -> String -> (PlotBars Double Double -> PlotBars Double Double) -> (Layout Double Double -> Layout Double Double) -> HistogramView

-- | This is a title used in HTML.
histogramTitle :: HistogramView -> String

-- | This is a description used in HTML.
histogramDescription :: HistogramView -> String

-- | The width of the histogram.
histogramWidth :: HistogramView -> Int

-- | The height of the histogram.
histogramHeight :: HistogramView -> Int

-- | It defines the file name with optional extension for each image to be
--   saved. It may include special variables <tt>$TITLE</tt>,
--   <tt>$RUN_INDEX</tt> and <tt>$RUN_COUNT</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   histogramFileName = UniqueFilePath "$TITLE - $RUN_INDEX"
--   </pre>
histogramFileName :: HistogramView -> ExperimentFilePath

-- | It specifies the predicate that defines when we count data when
--   plotting the histogram.
histogramPredicate :: HistogramView -> Event Bool

-- | Builds a histogram by the specified list of data series.
histogramBuild :: HistogramView -> [[Double]] -> Histogram

-- | The transform applied to the results before receiving series.
histogramTransform :: HistogramView -> ResultTransform

-- | It defines the series to be plotted on the histogram.
histogramSeries :: HistogramView -> ResultTransform

-- | This is a title used in the histogram when simulating a single run. It
--   may include special variable <tt>$TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   histogramPlotTitle = "$TITLE"
--   </pre>
histogramPlotTitle :: HistogramView -> String

-- | The run title for the histogram. It is used when simulating multiple
--   runs and it may include special variables <tt>$RUN_INDEX</tt>,
--   <tt>$RUN_COUNT</tt> and <tt>$PLOT_TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   histogramRunPlotTitle = "$PLOT_TITLE / Run $RUN_INDEX of $RUN_COUNT"
--   </pre>
histogramRunPlotTitle :: HistogramView -> String

-- | A transformation based on which the plot bar is constructed for the
--   series.
--   
--   Here you can define a colour or style of the plot bars.
histogramPlotBars :: HistogramView -> PlotBars Double Double -> PlotBars Double Double

-- | A transformation of the plot layout, where you can redefine the axes,
--   for example.
histogramLayout :: HistogramView -> Layout Double Double -> Layout Double Double

-- | The default histogram view.
defaultHistogramView :: HistogramView
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView HistogramView (FileRenderer r)
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView HistogramView (WebPageRenderer r)


-- | Tested with: GHC 7.10.1
--   
--   The module defines <a>FinalHistogramView</a> that plots a histogram by
--   the specified series in final time points collected from different
--   simulation runs.
module Simulation.Aivika.Experiment.Chart.FinalHistogramView

-- | Defines the <tt>View</tt> that plots the histogram for the specified
--   series in final time points collected from different simulation runs.
data FinalHistogramView
FinalHistogramView :: String -> String -> Int -> Int -> ExperimentFilePath -> Event Bool -> ([[Double]] -> Histogram) -> ResultTransform -> ResultTransform -> String -> (PlotBars Double Double -> PlotBars Double Double) -> (Layout Double Double -> Layout Double Double) -> FinalHistogramView

-- | This is a title used in HTML.
finalHistogramTitle :: FinalHistogramView -> String

-- | This is a description used in HTML.
finalHistogramDescription :: FinalHistogramView -> String

-- | The width of the histogram.
finalHistogramWidth :: FinalHistogramView -> Int

-- | The height of the histogram.
finalHistogramHeight :: FinalHistogramView -> Int

-- | It defines the file name with optional extension for each image to be
--   saved. It may include special variable <tt>$TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   finalHistogramFileName = UniqueFilePath "$TITLE"
--   </pre>
finalHistogramFileName :: FinalHistogramView -> ExperimentFilePath

-- | It specifies the predicate that defines when we count data when
--   plotting the histogram.
finalHistogramPredicate :: FinalHistogramView -> Event Bool

-- | Builds a histogram by the specified list of data series.
finalHistogramBuild :: FinalHistogramView -> [[Double]] -> Histogram

-- | The transform applied to the results before receiving series.
finalHistogramTransform :: FinalHistogramView -> ResultTransform

-- | It defines the series to be plotted on the histogram.
finalHistogramSeries :: FinalHistogramView -> ResultTransform

-- | This is a title used in the histogram. It may include special variable
--   <tt>$TITLE</tt>.
--   
--   An example is
--   
--   <pre>
--   finalHistogramPlotTitle = "$TITLE"
--   </pre>
finalHistogramPlotTitle :: FinalHistogramView -> String

-- | A transformation based on which the plot bar is constructed for the
--   series.
--   
--   Here you can define a colour or style of the plot bars.
finalHistogramPlotBars :: FinalHistogramView -> PlotBars Double Double -> PlotBars Double Double

-- | A transformation of the plot layout, where you can redefine the axes,
--   for example.
finalHistogramLayout :: FinalHistogramView -> Layout Double Double -> Layout Double Double

-- | The default histogram view.
defaultFinalHistogramView :: FinalHistogramView
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView FinalHistogramView (FileRenderer r)
instance ChartRendering r => ExperimentView FinalHistogramView (WebPageRenderer r)


-- | Tested with: GHC 7.10.1
--   
--   This module re-exports the library functionality.
module Simulation.Aivika.Experiment.Chart
